attributes.action: Ban all appearance based school rules (hair, jewellery, nails, makeup)
attributes.additional_details: We get told off for necklaces, hair et.c. But none of this affects our learning and we should be allowed to wear a locket with a family member in it, honour a friend by wearing a ring they bought us, compulsively dye our hair, or keep our nails on until they break because they were expensive, without worrying that we’re going to be kept from our education, shouted at, put in isolation, sent home, or have our property wrongly confiscated. We should have the rights for these. Our body, our choice.
attributes.background: Disdain rules about hair, jewellery, makeup, nails et.c Staff waste their time punishing us on it when there is so much worse going on such as racism & rape threatening. An assembly was held about the ‘one stud’ rule by a teacher with three massive hoops in each ear. It’s hypocritical & unfair.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/611540

If you are aware of or concerned about behaviour by students or staff in a school, you should raise this with your parent or the school safeguarding lead.

If you need advice about a problem at school, you could contact Childline, a charity that provides free and confidential advice to children: https://www.childline.org.uk/
